alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 10 at 10:33PM MST until January 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Lincoln County, South Central Mountains, and Southwest Chaves County. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds may blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches are likely near Ruidoso. Higher amounts near 6 inches are likely on the peaks. Blowing snow is likely as well, with visibility reduced to less than one mile at times.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Lincoln County; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County
